meanings.definition: Of or relating to a caryatid
meanings.sent1: The caryatic statue stood gracefully in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed a caryatic building with intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The caryatic figure seemed to come alive at night, dancing in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: Her movements were caryatic, as if she carried the weight of the world on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The caryatic columns of the ancient temple added a sense of grandeur to the structure.

meanings.sent1: The elaborate chandelier had a caryatic design with intricate carvings.
meanings.sent2: The new building had caryatic features that reminded people of ancient Greek architecture.
meanings.sent3: The caryatic pattern on the wallpaper made the room feel like a royal chamber.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was styled in a caryatic bun, adding a touch of elegance to her look.
meanings.sent5: The caryatic mask worn by the performer added an air of mystery to the play.

meanings.definition: Supporting a structure like a caryatid
meanings.sent1: The strong pillars had a caryatic function, holding up the entire roof of the temple.
meanings.sent2: The massive beams played a caryatic role in supporting the weight of the bridge.
meanings.sent3: The caryatic beams groaned under the heavy load, but they held firm.
meanings.sent4: The caryatic support system of the building was crucial for its stability.
meanings.sent5: The caryatic foundation of the tower ensured its durability through the centuries.
